# How To Docs

## How-to C# articles

- [Article index](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/how-to/index.md): A collection of quick tips and short, focused code samples
- [Split strings into substrings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/how-to/parse-strings-using-split.md): The Split method returns an array of strings split from a set of delimiters. It's an easy way to extract substrings from a string.
- [Concatenate strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/how-to/concatenate-multiple-strings.md): There are multiple ways to concatenate strings in C#. Learn the options and the reasons behind different choices.
- [Search strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/how-to/search-strings.md): Learn about two strategies to search for text in strings in C#. String class methods search for specific text. Regular expressions search for patterns in text.
- [Modify string contents](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/how-to/modify-string-contents.md): Review examples of several techniques to modify existing string contents in C#, which return a new string object.
- [Compare strings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/how-to/compare-strings.md): Learn how to compare and order string values, with or without case, with or without culture specific ordering.
- [How to catch a non-CLS exception](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/how-to/how-to-catch-a-non-cls-exception.md): Learn how to catch a non-CLS exception. See a code example and view additional available resources.
